metadata.Title: CVE-2016-0741 on Ubuntu 18.04 FIPS Compliant (bionic) - medium.
metadata.Description:
slapd/connection.c in 389 Directory Server (formerly Fedora Directory Server) 1.3.4.x before 1.3.4.7 allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service (infinite loop and connection blocking) by leveraging an abnormally closed connection.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2016-0741` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

389-ds - 1.3.7.10-1ubuntu1
389-ds-base - 1.3.7.10-1ubuntu1
389-ds-base-libs - 1.3.7.10-1ubuntu1
python3-dirsrvtests - 1.3.7.10-1ubuntu1
python3-lib389 - 1.3.7.10-1ubuntu1
No subscription required

notes.Note: leosilva> code is quite different in trusty than patch, probably a trick backport. ebarretto> only affects 1.3.4 and up sbeattie> see UCT commit history when researching

criterions.comment: 389-ds-base package in bionic, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '1.3.7.10-1ubuntu1').
